image.altText: A Collingwood defender grimaces as he takes a contested mark as an Adelaide player collides with him.

props.synopsis: Magpies player Isaac Quaynor says he tried to block out the noise after Crows fans booed him during their qualifying final clash.

title.children: Pies player who was the victim of slur tries to block out booing fans

image.altText: Education Minister Blair Boyer talking to a reporter

props.synopsis: South Australia's Education Minister believes there is more work to be done to boost safeguards within the childcare sector. He says well-trained staff would be the key to preventing "shocking things happening to kids".

title.children: SA education minister says childcare staff key to preventing ‘shocking’ incidents

image.altText: A cartoon character screenshot from the video game hollow knight silksong

props.synopsis: After years of silence, Team Cherry has released their sequel to one of the most successful Australian-made games of all time, which is expected to break records.

title.children: Australian-made Hollow Knight: Silksong crashes global stores on launch

image.altText: A woman holding a pregnancy test.

props.synopsis: A renewed push to change South Australia's pregnancy termination laws is set to be introduced to the state's parliament, with an independent MP proposing to place significant new restrictions on abortion access.

title.children: New push to change South Australian abortion laws

image.altText: Smoke about the Lucindale grass fire

props.synopsis: A judge finds that vegetation heaps lit on fire by grazier Tom Brinkworth burned for six months before causing a bushfire that destroyed three houses.

title.children: Supreme Court rules late pastoralist's actions led to SA bushfire

image.altText: People in suit jackets outside court.

props.synopsis: Prominent Melbourne property investor Adrian Portelli pleads not guilty in an Adelaide court to 19 charges relating to allegations he was running "unlawful lotteries in South Australia".

title.children: Adrian Portelli blames illegal lotteries trial on 'big miscommunication'

image.altText: A middle-aged man with a light, grey beard wears high-vis as he holds leaves hanging from a tree in his hands.

props.synopsis: Producers and beekeepers had been expecting the arrival of the parasite. Now they are bracing for impact.

title.children: Uncertainty for SA communities after first varroa mite detection

image.altText: Taylor Walker looks to evade a Darcy Moore tackle while running with the ball

props.synopsis: Taylor Walker has become one of the AFL's premier forwards, but in Broken Hill in 2007, spectators got a sneak peek of the future.

title.children: From the Bulldogs to the big time, Broken Hill celebrates Tex's 300th game

image.altText: composite image of Vincent Tarzia on a stage, Troy Bell outdoors

props.synopsis: With the departure of Troy Bell this week, the South Australian Liberal Party had its sights set on finally winning a by-election. Instead, they were reminded of their 28-year political nightmare.

title.children: Mad Monday beers, a UK theatre fan and a 28-year Liberal Party nightmare

image.altText: Troy Bell looks serious while being filmed in camera

props.synopsis: Former South Australian MP Troy Bell, who was previously found guilty of serious fraud charges, is also facing a raft of deception allegations, it can be revealed.

title.children: Former SA MP charged over alleged misuse of accommodation allowance

image.altText: Honeybees on a frame, beekeeper points a finger at the queen bee.

props.synopsis: The "world's worst" honey bee parasite, varroa mite, has been detected in South Australia for the first time. Now in five jurisdictions across Australia, what impact will it have on the agricultural industry?

title.children: A honey bee-killing parasite is in SA for the first time. What impact will it have?

image.altText: A small stone church with a wall at the front.

props.synopsis: A church in Mount Gambier that was set to become an Airbnb will again open its doors to the faithful after the Greek Orthodox Diocese of Adelaide purchased it.

title.children: Church to reopen for worship after 'divine intervention' nixes Airbnb plan

image.altText: A composite image with headshots of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: The prime minister says the pair had a "warm and constructive" conversation about trade, critical minerals and shared security interests.

title.children: PM says he had 'warm and constructive' conversation with Trump

image.altText: A Fronius home battery and inverter setup.

props.synopsis: Home battery installers in Western Australia say they're collectively owed millions of dollars in rebates and loans from a government scheme.

title.children: As batteries boom, installers are boycotting one state's rebate scheme

image.altText: A woman in dark blue football kit, running.

props.synopsis: Matildas superstar Sam Kerr is named to play for Chelsea this weekend in the Women's Super League opener.

title.children: Kerr's long-awaited return arrives as coach confirms Chelsea selection

image.altText: A smashed cable car can be seen on a steep road.

props.synopsis: A maintenance tender for the 140-year-old funicular that crashed in Lisbon on Wednesday, killing 16 people, was cancelled earlier this week because the bids were too expensive.

title.children: Maintenance tender scrapped days before deadly Lisbon cable car crash

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy looking on as Emmanuel Macron speaks at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The forces would be deployed on day one of any peace deal between Ukraine and Russia, aiming to prevent another invasion of the country.

title.children: Coalition of 26 countries commit to Ukraine post-war peacekeeping force

image.altText: A man and a woman bump bellies together.

props.synopsis: Writer and performer Lorin Clarke ropes in the cream of Australia's comedy crop to celebrate the life and work of her father, John, in her new documentary.

title.children: But Also John Clarke is a tender look at Australia's greatest satirist

image.altText: Giorgio Armani, a man with white grey hair and tan skin wearing a grey long sleeve shirt, smiling.

props.synopsis: The Italian founded a fashion empire that became synonymous with elegance, style and Hollywood red carpets.

title.children: Giorgio Armani, legendary Italian fashion designer, dies aged 91

image.altText: A man lays in a hospital bed, with his leg bandaged and attached to a brick

props.synopsis: Israel's planned military offensive to take Gaza City is threatening thousands of hospital patients who cannot evacuate or have no place else to go.

title.children: Broken leg wrapped with bandages and bricks: Why the injured cannot evacuate Gaza City

image.altText: A sad child sits in a chair with their face hidden behind their hair

props.synopsis: There can be a range of clues parents can pick up on when their child is being bullied. Here's how to approach it with your child, and how to advocate for them at school.

title.children: What if your child is being bullied, but the school won't act?

image.altText: ANZAC Dawn service at Melbourne's Shine of Remembrance

props.synopsis: A 23-year-old man will face court in November charged with disrupting the Anzac Day dawn service in Melbourne. He was arrested in the company of Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell this week.

title.children: Man linked to Neo-Nazis charged over Anzac Day boos

image.altText: A colourised photo of a Tasmanian tiger.

props.synopsis: Even after a long life, Peggie Bassett can still remember the guttural growl and striking scent of the last known thylacine as it prowled its concrete enclosure.

title.children: Peggie saw a thylacine as a child. She wouldn't ever want to 'go back and see it'

image.altText: A reddish full moon.

props.synopsis: A total lunar eclipse, also known as a "blood moon", will be visible across all of Australia next week. Here's what you need to know to get the best view and snap the best photo.

title.children: When and where can I see Monday's total lunar eclipse from Australia?

image.altText: Woman with a handful of bright clothes.

props.synopsis: A Ballina Council audit finds 80 per cent of clothes thrown away are in perfect or near-perfect condition, sometimes with the tags still on.

title.children: Masses of near-perfect clothing thrown in rubbish bin, tip hunt finds

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Australian shares are following global markets higher as traders become more convinced the US Federal Reserve will resume cutting interest rates this month. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX gains as global interest rate fears subside

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Supermarket wage theft class action continues

image.altText: A man in his late 20s in a hat with tattoos covering his neck and shoulders.

props.synopsis: The federal government's $475 million compensation to Robodebt victims may do little to alleviate the "pain and anguish" for those who lost loved ones over the scandal.

title.children: Robodebt pushed victims to the brink, and some did not live to see justice

image.altText: A police hat and a bouquet of flowers sit atop a coffin draped in an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Vadim de Waart-Hottart, one of two officers killed in a shooting in Victoria's north-east last week, is being farewelled at a police funeral with full honours in Melbourne.

title.children: A thousand people pack church to farewell officer slain in Porepunkah shooting

image.altText: Three men in suits walk in a row

props.synopsis: It was another huge week of news. Did you catch it all? Test your memory here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A viral Trump rumour, an ex-politician under fire and de Minaur's bad luck

image.altText: A solar system installer adjusts solar panels on the roof of a house.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's energy saver loan scheme gave households and small businesses a chance to obtain interest-free finance for rooftop solar and other energy efficiency measures. It's been so successful, the government decided to end it.

title.children: Scheme to winter-proof houses too successful for its own good

image.altText: German defenders watch the ball hit the back of the net as the diving goalkeeper is beaten.

props.synopsis: Germany has been one of the dominant nations in world football for decades, but the team has to lift to avoid play-offs to make it to the World Cup after a stunning loss to Slovakia.

title.children: Germany in trouble after first-ever away World Cup qualifier loss

image.altText: A young basketballer flexes in triumph atr a training session.

props.synopsis: Rocco Zikarsky is about to head back to the United States to prepare for the NBA preseason after he was drafted by the Minnesota Timberwolves, where he will suit up alongside his countryman Joe Ingles.

title.children: Australian teenager standing 7-foot-4 gears up for NBA preseason

image.altText: A blonde woman faces a press pack

props.synopsis: Convicted baby killer Keli Lane is suing the NSW government for $2 million, alleging it failed in its duty of care to protect her from serious harm at the hands of several prison officers, including serial sex abuser Wayne Astill.

title.children: Baby killer Keli Lane sues NSW government over prison sexual abuse scandal

image.altText: A field of everlasting flowers.

props.synopsis: Armed with cameras and notepads, thousands of tourists hit tiny towns in WA's Midwest for the start of wildflower season.

title.children: Late winter rains trigger spectacular start to wildflower season in WA
